findings.title: Predictable and manipulable randomness using block timestamp
findings.explanation: The contract uses `now % 15 == 0` to decide winners. Block timestamps are set by miners within a manipulable window, so a malicious miner can force the timestamp to be a multiple of 15 when they play (guaranteeing a win) or avoid such timestamps when others play (denying them any chance). This makes the randomness fully predictable and controllable.
